head.title: How to Be a Cool Mom

hedline.hl1: How to Be a Cool Mom

abstract.p: Carol Weston letter reminds parents that children want and need both love and limits (S)

block.p: In ''Am I a Cool Mother?'' (Op-Ed, May 13), Susan Borowitz realizes that it's better to be a parent than a teen wannabe. She notes that another mom gets enviable coolness points because she allows her preteen daughter stay up until midnight and have her own phone and TV.

In ''Am I a Cool Mother?'' (Op-Ed, May 13), Susan Borowitz realizes that it's better to be a parent than a teen wannabe. She notes that another mom gets enviable coolness points because she allows her preteen daughter stay up until midnight and have her own phone and TV.

Well, guess what? When parents have a hard time saying no to children, children often have a hard time saying no to drugs, drinking, sex and other teenage temptations. As an advice columnist and author of books for girls, I can assure you that children want -- and need -- both love and limits.
